text: The next time frame participant we're going to discuss is the intermediate trader or investor. Intermediate traders or investors, also known as swing traders, they're very similar to short term traders but they operate from a slightly longer term time frame. For instance, a short term trader would tend to operate from, say, a 30 minute A Intermediate Trader investor would tend to operate from a 60-minute, 4-hour, daily, weekly and monthly type of time frame. The Intermediate Trader finds a strong balance between fundamentals and market-generated information. So they're equally balanced between technicals and fundamentals, whereas the Day Trader As an example, if we look at the profile below, as we can see, we have very strong trend-like Now, an intermediate type trader or an investor will look to continue to hold this market so long as it keeps holding this one time framing pattern or making these higher lows and higher highs. As we can see, they tend to use daily type candles as opposed to the shorter term
transcript: The next time frame participant we're going to discuss is the intermediate trader or investor. Intermediate traders or investors, also known as swing traders, they're very similar to short term traders but they operate from a slightly longer term time frame. For instance, a short term trader would tend to operate from, say, a 30 minute A Intermediate Trader investor would tend to operate from a 60-minute, 4-hour, daily, weekly and monthly type of time frame. The Intermediate Trader finds a strong balance between fundamentals and market-generated information. So they're equally balanced between technicals and fundamentals, whereas the Day Trader As an example, if we look at the profile below, as we can see, we have very strong trend-like Now, an intermediate type trader or an investor will look to continue to hold this market so long as it keeps holding this one time framing pattern or making these higher lows and higher highs. As we can see, they tend to use daily type candles as opposed to the shorter term
